adjectives.description: rudimentary (comparative more rudimentary, superlative most rudimentary)

entries.meaning: Of or relating to one or more rudiments.
examples: I have only a rudimentary grasp of chemistry.

entries.meaning: Basic; minimal; with less than, or only the minimum, necessary.
examples: His grasp of rudimentary English allowed him at least to do the shopping.
His rudimentary driving skills meant that he was a danger on the road.

entries.meaning: (zoology, usually in the plural) One of the rudimentary mammae of boars.
